noun.description: The action or practice of pasturing livestock, especially cattle, on fog. Also Law: the right or privilege to pasture livestock on fog. Now historical.
Agriculture. Grass used for grazing; specifically (a) rough or long grass; (b) a second crop of grass which grows after the hay harvest.

origin: Late 15th century. From post-classical Latin fogagium payment for grazing on rough or long grass, probably from foggum + -agium.
